title: Inconsistent NULL transactions
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `Geth/v1.7.2-stable-1db4ecdc/darwin-amd64/go1.9.1`
OS & Version: OSX
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour
Expected to receive the transaction objects.

#### Actual behaviour
When using my own local node (10k blocks off fully synced), I receive multiple errors in the node console:

```write tcp 127.0.0.1:9001->127.0.0.1:61969: write: broken pipe```

So then I thought maybe it was something wrong with my own geth node, and I tried using infura's, now the node doesn't crash but I receive some weird results:

`First run:`
```
transaction: 0x315c39e5d63b1465ac2a2ecc544a25a66bc86ebc29bcc1515b07b00b70deacf8 [object Object]
transaction: 0x3b3b3568315ddbb81ddd7ca91d061bf9fc1587c423939f114b6e2adc27c88fe6 [object Object]
transaction: 0x5cd37f4e5aece224d0d8f1b833e501b8b0d06d22515050bb25d3158ac92e8774 [object Object]
transaction: 0xcba3ab8ee47aef4227b9756d5aa0e77428a92721774a5f71bf07b6b5c5bc9680 null
transaction: 0x80e834ac9ce6c35e28c73fbafad2cf8ff484cf5346a75da5e07cf3fee61f4733 [object Object]
transaction: 0xf4216aa82bc0e548cb8084959913d763507817c78c3293bebf23bb95bde31532 [object Object]

```
`Second run:`
```
transaction: 0x315c39e5d63b1465ac2a2ecc544a25a66bc86ebc29bcc1515b07b00b70deacf8 [object Object]
transaction: 0x3b3b3568315ddbb81ddd7ca91d061bf9fc1587c423939f114b6e2adc27c88fe6 [object Object]
transaction: 0x5cd37f4e5aece224d0d8f1b833e501b8b0d06d22515050bb25d3158ac92e8774 [object Object]
transaction: 0xcba3ab8ee47aef4227b9756d5aa0e77428a92721774a5f71bf07b6b5c5bc9680 [object Object]
transaction: 0x80e834ac9ce6c35e28c73fbafad2cf8ff484cf5346a75da5e07cf3fee61f4733 [object Object]
transaction: 0xf4216aa82bc0e548cb8084959913d763507817c78c3293bebf23bb95bde31532 null

```
`Third run:`
```
transaction: 0x315c39e5d63b1465ac2a2ecc544a25a66bc86ebc29bcc1515b07b00b70deacf8 [object Object]
transaction: 0x3b3b3568315ddbb81ddd7ca91d061bf9fc1587c423939f114b6e2adc27c88fe6 [object Object]
transaction: 0x5cd37f4e5aece224d0d8f1b833e501b8b0d06d22515050bb25d3158ac92e8774 [object Object]
transaction: 0xcba3ab8ee47aef4227b9756d5aa0e77428a92721774a5f71bf07b6b5c5bc9680 [object Object]
transaction: 0x80e834ac9ce6c35e28c73fbafad2cf8ff484cf5346a75da5e07cf3fee61f4733 null
transaction: 0xf4216aa82bc0e548cb8084959913d763507817c78c3293bebf23bb95bde31532 [object Object]

```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Maybe related: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/2434

This is basically a snippet from a bigger script I'm running on the mainnet chain.

```
  // Block: 2806264
  const transactionHashes = [
    '0x315c39e5d63b1465ac2a2ecc544a25a66bc86ebc29bcc1515b07b00b70deacf8',
    '0x3b3b3568315ddbb81ddd7ca91d061bf9fc1587c423939f114b6e2adc27c88fe6',
    '0x5cd37f4e5aece224d0d8f1b833e501b8b0d06d22515050bb25d3158ac92e8774',
    '0xcba3ab8ee47aef4227b9756d5aa0e77428a92721774a5f71bf07b6b5c5bc9680',
    '0x80e834ac9ce6c35e28c73fbafad2cf8ff484cf5346a75da5e07cf3fee61f4733',
    '0xf4216aa82bc0e548cb8084959913d763507817c78c3293bebf23bb95bde31532'
  ]

  Promise.all(transactionHashes.map(hash => web3.eth.getTransaction(hash)))
    .then(result => result.map((tx, i) => console.log(`transaction: ${transactionHashes[i]} ${tx}`)))
```
